page.title: 11An elderly resident speaks
page.content: This lady has lived in Trehafod,near Pontypridd,all her life and she said what a pretty name it was.Hafod means Summer Dwelling and Tre(town) was added later. She said the views around the village were wonderful-views such as Cwm George waterfall were equally as good as any view in Switzerland.The village has changed much during her lifetime-the number of children attending the school are now much smaller,fewer shops,the chapels which were once the centre of much of the village life are closed,the Welsh language widely used at one time is now rarely heard,and many other changes.However,the lady said that Trehafod has always been and still is a very friendly place and neighbours are very kind.It is a lovely place to live and she would not wish to live anywhere else.(By Roslyn Watkins)
